unnormalised: So, in this era of EdTech, I wanted to chat about scholarship portals – you know, the websites that promise to find you free money for college? Are they actually worth the hype?

unnormalised: I remember my cousin, Priya from Delhi, stressing about affording her B.Tech at IIT Kanpur. She spent ages filling out forms on like a dozen different portals. Did it pay off? Sort of. She did get a small merit-based scholarship through one, but it was more effort than she anticipated.

unnormalised: The good thing is, a lot of these portals aggregate scholarships from different sources – government schemes (like those offered by the MHRD), private trusts, and even international opportunities. It can be a good starting point to get an idea of what's out there.

unnormalised: But the downside? A lot of them are pretty generic and you still have to sift through a ton of irrelevant results. It's not as easy as the Bollywood movies make it seem, haha! Also, be careful about sharing your data! Read the fine print – some sites might sell your info.
